inn1.comm: over the wicket, pitched up and shaping a little back on off stump, Guptill pushes an on-drive wide of mid-on, who dives to stop it as the batsmen jog a single
slightly leg side, definitely some swing for Willey and McCullum ends up reaching for a flick off his pads, scoops it over short midwicket and away for a couple... Not entirely in control of that
on the stumps and flicked through square leg for one more
pitched up on off stump, straightening a fraction, drives gently to the man at extra cover
full and straight, touch under 80mph and holding its line, punched into the ground and Willey gets a hand to it in his follow through
pushed across outside the off stump and Guptill watches it through to the keeper
fullish outside off and punched into the covers half forward
dug in short, outside off and McCullum has a flash but misses the ball, "ooohs" around the ground
on the stumps, mid-80s mph from Finn, pushed towards mid-on coming forwards
gets this one into a gap wide of mid-on
short and at the body, Guptill drops back and defends down into the leg side
back of a length outside off, gets into line and shows it a straight bat
now McCullum does skip down the pitch, has a heave but miscues behind square on the leg side, runs past the man on the edge of the ring off the inside edge
pitched up, curling on off stump, poked defensively into the covers coming forwards
back of a length and covered from back in the crease
touch short again, stays on top of it and picks a gap at cover
half an appeal, McCullum struck on the pads... maybe some bat involved and it must have pitched outside leg, anyway
full, little bit of width and this is driven square, not quite both barrels but it has enough to get to the rope, first boundary of the innings
line and length outside off, up towards 87mph, Guptill drops back and watches it through
back of a length over the top of off stump, dabbed down into the ground
tight line from Finn, this is 88mph and blocked diligently down into the off side by the watchful Guptill
fuller and punched back on the drive, just leaned on it but the ball went straight to mid-on
pitched up on middle and leg and this is whipped away through midwicket, again not the cleanest connection and they get three
Finn not giving anything away so far, shortish on the stumps and worked wide of mid-on for one
pitched up and McCullum again walks down the track, swings hard and squirts a thickish inside edge through midwicket for a couple, Willey has cover out there
on the stumps, worked through square on the leg side
touch full outside off, this doesn't swing and Guptill aims big down the ground, comes off the outer half of the bat and loops over backward point but there's enough on it to get to the fence
straighter line and nudged away through square leg for one more
banged in short, McCullum watches it through - too high
pushed across the right-hander, Baz feels for it and gets a low edge through gully for one to third man
leg-stump line, 80mph and pushed to the fielder at midwicket
short of a length over the top of off, McCullum jumps back and tucks it short on the leg side for a stolen single
good aggression from Finn, gets this to bounce off as length and surprise the batsman, who manages to keep it down
slightly short, goes back outside off and defends
fuller, in the channel outside off, tentative drive into the covers from Guptill
short ball, bouncy bouncer and it's called on height

back of a length and seaming in to take the edge of Guptill's bat, excellent delivery but the batsman gets runs, the inside edge flying a few yards to Buttler's left and away for four - no chance for the keeper
shortish around the line of off and this is defended with a straight bat
pitched up and driven, another scratchy swing from B-Mac, who's struggling for timing but manages to clear the ring on the off side
back of a length and defended in the crease
and Willey duly goes leg side, slightly short and McCullum swings and misses
full toss, a slower ball from Willey, toe-ended to one of the men at short midwicket
full on leg stump and McCullum takes his tithe, free swing of the arms and he clubs four over mid-on, bouncing away
length delivery over off stump, defended into the off side
on the stumps, tight line from Willey, not quite there to drive, 83mph and defended watchfully towards mid-off
line and length from Finn, around the line of off, prodded into off side coming forwards
back of a length, parsimonious stuff from Finn, Guptill stays back and defends
touch too straight, maybe a cutter from Finn, clips the inside half of the bat and runs away down to fine leg for four
back to pounding away short of a length outside off, dabbed towards backward point

pitched up and driven uppishly, Finn gets down to his left but drops it! Really good effort from Finn, it was only a few inches off the ground, but the ball struck him on the wrists and went to earth. Grazed knees for nothing
and this is larruped for four, booming cover drive from Guptill in response! More pain for Finn, slightly overpitched and thrashed past the diving mid-off
full and straight, McCullum basically blocks it straight back past the bowler, takes the run and would've have been in even if mid-on's throw had hit
on the stumps, slightly too straight from Wood and this is pinged for four, superbly timed off the pads by Guptill, gives mid-on no chance
length delivery on off stump, defended coming across
fullish and flicked away, high over mid-on, wristy stroke from Guptill and he picks up his second boundary of the over
shorter length and defended on off stump
full of a length outside off, 86mph and driven with a princely follow through but straight to mid-on
outside off, short of a good length, McCullum stays back to defend
there's the first six of the match, and it comes via a familiar source, McCullum skipping out to Steve Finn like it was the Cake Tin all over and smoking him over long-off
back of a length, seams fraction and cramps McCullum, manages to chop it down wide of third man for two
short outside off again, dropped behind gully for one... stumps knocked out of the ground by the throw but Guptill was home
on the stumps, length delivery pushed back towards mid-on
slightly short and worked off the body into the leg side
starts down the leg side and Buttler misses it... not the best start for this plan
better line from Willey, fullish on off stump, defended gently into the off side from the crease
length delivery, McCullum opens the face and steers towards backward point, they trot a single
touch full, around the line of off, tapped into the covers reaching out for it
pitched up on off stump, 83mph and tempting the drive, Guptill hits it with a fiery fury but sends a bump ball straight to extra cover... The crowd cheers what it thinks is the first wicket
good length in the channel, driven on the up along the carpet to mid-off

goes around the wicket, changes the angle... and Guptill produces the most extraordinary shot, nothing more than a pick-up flick off his front pad but it goes soaring over deep midwicket for six. Used the angle of the delivery and then stood to admire the result

length ball on the stumps, McCullum charges and gets an inside edge but Buttler only gets his fingertips to it, tough chance but it was catchable, the ball runs away for a single. Slightly shoddy work from the keeper, going low to his left
short and worked off the body through square leg
on the stumps, pushed wide of mid-on
dug in, Guptill drops back and rolls his wrists on a pull through midwicket for two
line and length in the channel outside off, Wood maybe beginning to settle, Guptill leaves
touch fuller, inviting the drive, 89mph and Guptill mistimes it towards mid-off
length ball to start off with, actually a slower delivery, McCullum skips out but has time to readjust and pat one through the covers
length delivery on off stump, pushed into the covers
pitched up and Guptill takes the invitation to drive, crashes it to extra cover... but Stokes had overstepped
full toss outside off from Stokes and Guptill windmills his arms through, gets a thick outside edge and it beats third man
length and tighter to the stumps, dabbed into the off side
slightly full, around the line of off, presses forwards with bat next to pad
tries another slower ball, bobbles away down the leg side
short, 84mph at the body, tucked down into the leg side and midwicket is quick to cut it off

there it is, back of a length from Wood, excellent line and McCullum nicks off! Good pace, there's some extra bounce and no room for McCullum to cut, still he tried only to get a thin deflection through to Buttler, who holds on this time
length ball on off stump, defended from the crease into the off side
full on the stumps, looking to sneak one through, Williamson times it neatly off his pads through midwicket for a couple to get going
banged in short, climbing rapidly outside off, Williamson elects to leave it alone, ducks
pitched up on off stump, nudging 90mph, driven towards mid-on, the bat turning slightly in the hands
back of a length outside off, drops into the crease to defend
slightly full and in the slot to drive, Guptill flays it through the covers to the sweeper
drops back and runs one down to third man
goes wide on the crease and fires the ball on middle stump, holds his head on his hands as Guptill flicks across the line, gets bat on it

fullish and clipped off the pads again, in the air and dropped again, this time Root the culprit! Went straight to him, between the legs but he was down, just made a mess of it. Hurls the ball in frustration
length outside off, skips out and launches himself at the ball, gets a thick outside edge that bounces down to third man
short ball at the body, tapped down to leg
worked away behind square on the leg side
tight line over the top of off, Williamson lines it up and defends solidly

in the channel, draws Williamson out and this takes the edge but drops short, bounces towards Stokes at second slip, who fails to grabs it at the first attempt and they get a single - sloppy again from England
Wood jumps wide on the crease, fired in at the stumps, nudged to midwicket
short outside off, 89mph and steered into the ground towards backward point
back of a length, this is an excellent line from Wood, again Guptill can't get him away through point
full length a couple of feet wide of off stump, Williamson leans into a delicious cover drive and times it wide of mid-off, superb stroke
good comeback though, beats the bat, not as full, Williamson feeling for this on a similar line
straighter and this is clipped out through square leg
good length around off, Guptill forward, gets a thick inside edge fine of Buttler for another single
just coming forward to defend this around off
back of a length and too wide so Williamson cuts and gets it wide of third man, very well played
what a shot this is, only a press but times so well that it runs past mid-on for four, fifty for Guptill in 59 balls
just dabs this out to cover
too short and hammered into the covers but Billings dives to his left at cover to save, top work
very full around middle and off, this is dug out into midwicket
not as full, this is dabbed up to mid-on
tad fuller and driven, this up to mid-off
full and wide, Williamson eases it through the covers, lovely stroke
waits for this and angles down to third man
flicked out to deep square this time

slower ball and Guptill goes hard it and puts it miles into the air towards midwicket, Finn is running back and takes the catch! A superb take, very difficult that watching it come over your shoulder and he's held on very well here. False stroke from Guptill, took one hand off the bat, and had no control, was just hoping it would evade Finn but he's taken a great catch
full and wide, Williamson leans out to cut this only to backward point
angled in, this is flicked out to deep square
back of a length at the body, this is helped on it's way down the leg side and fine of long leg
back again, this time just tapping this into midwicket for a single

gets the yorker in, it's dug out up the wicket, the umpire thought it was bat first, England didn't and think about it and go for the review but it's not in time! Review denied and probably just as well because it looks outside the line even if it was pad first, which it might have been
length around off stump, Taylor tentatively forward to defend into the covers
slightly wider on the bowling crease, easy to defend this coming half-forward
forward driving on the up but short of backward point
full at the off stump, this is blocked back to the bowler
straighter, this is flicked leg side and out into the deep for a single
very full just outside off, Taylor flicks up to mid-off
angled into a straighter line, this is clipped wide of mid-off and they take a quick single
wide line outside off and Williamson is able to swing through the line here and beats the off side sweeper to the short boundary
not quite as wide and this is mistimed up towards mid-off this time
this is just full enough to drive outside off and Taylor strikes it nicely through cover point, excellent timing, not without it's risks
tighter line and just blocked up to mid-off this time
Wood jumps wide on the bowling crease, Taylor blocks from the crease out into the covers

drives a fuller ball and gets a thick outside edge...just wide of a diving backward point, Roy leaping away to his left and actually got a hand there but couldn't make the grab, would have been a superb catch
length ball a foot outside off, Taylor trying to back-cut misses, a little cramped
two feet outside off, just left alone this time
full wide delivery driven at and gets a thick outside edge down to third man, there is a gully in place but this is well wide of him
full length, tries to dig this out on the off side but misses
length ball, Taylor forward to just defend this
angled in straighter, this is worked up inside mid-on but not enough for a single
too straight and helped down the leg side fine of long leg, not the worst ball but stray in line at your peril
back onto a fourth-stump area, this is worked with the angle out through midwicket
full length on the stumps, worked out through midwicket
outside off, waited for and cut out to deep cover
tossed up, slides into the pads but would have gone down leg
full enough length to press this down to long-on
touch short, Taylor fails to cut with any power and finds midwicket
tossed up just outside off, this is driven down to long-off
full on the stumps, this is tapped up to midwicket
gets this to bounce a touch around off stump and Taylor gets a thick shoulder of the bat down to third man
waits for this and dabs down to third man
straight line, this is played forward back to the bowler
fuller length and this is driven in the air but short and wide of cover
top shot here, up on his toes to drive down the ground inside mid-off but long-on is able to come around to make the save
thrown up wide of off stump, this is driven out to deep cover
down the track, meets this on the full and whacks it wide of deep midwicket, finds the gap so well does Williamson
sends the slider in, tad short and this is punched off the back foot down to long-on
floated up around off stump, Taylor forward playing firmly down to long-off
goes to flick leg side and gets a thick leading edge but safely over the bowler's head
back and pressing this down to long-on
full at the stump, this is driven steadily down to long-on
length ball around middle and off, this is blocked back to the bowler
fuller and long-on is doing the fielding once more
waits for this and angles down to third man
shorter and this is pulled out backward of deep square and runs for four, long leg up at the moment
perhaps over compensates, this is now driven, didn't seem that well timed but it races away and beats deep cover to the short boundary
tossed up wide of off stump, this is left alone
fuller length, this is driven to cover
dragged down, slipped down leg too and Taylor helps it on the way to the fine leg fence
floated up outside off again, this time Taylor drives and finds deep cover scrambling to his right
this drive finds extra-cover
straighter line, this is touched up to midwicket
full length a foot or so wide of off stump, this is driven up to mid-off
length ball now and this is just blocked out into the covers
wider on the bowling crease, wide enough of off stump to angle this down to third man and that's yet another fifty for Williamson, extraordinary form this series
full length wide of off stump, Taylor leans into a drive here and deep cover is going quickly to his left to save the boundary
gets across the stumps to flick a slower ball very fine here and it runs away fine of long leg
tight fourth-stump line now, this is just blocked in the crease
floated up around middle and leg, this is dabbed out through square leg
full on the stumps, this is pressed down to long-on
forward touching a straighter ball fine of square leg for a single
touch short and pulled out to deep midwicket
full ball slips down leg
back on the stumps punching this out to long-on
short enough to pull this but not wide enough of midwicket for a second
tossed up and Williamson chips it down the ground, long-on was running in but couldn't quite get there
angled in with the arm from over the wicket, nudged through square leg for one
tossed up outside the line of off, Taylor reaches forward and punches through the covers
flat offbreak outside off, pushed back to the bowler
oh, that's come out wrong, sprayed down the leg side
flighted, on the stumps, clipped through midwicket, busy feet from Williamson
angled in on middle and off, closes the face and works to leg for another single
flighted, outside off, comes forward and drills one to the sweeper
on the stumps, straightening from leg, defended watchfully half forward
gives this some air and Williamson advances, chips over midwicket for a couple to the man running around
flighted outside off, comes forward and drills to extra cover, it was a bump ball but the crowd gasped when he couldn't hold on
floated right up under the eyes, Williamson makes a move to the pitch and lofts a regal drive straight down the ground for six. Fetched it slightly but easily cleared the rope
shortens his length, bounces up outside off and dabbed to backward point

flat, bounces a bit and Taylor punches off the back foot, Root dives to his right but the ball hits the toe of Williamson's bat and deflects into the ground... I think he might have got to that, otherwise
tossed up on the stumps, defended
worked away through midwicket for a single
angled in with the arm, comes forward and pushes a single down the ground to long-on
flat offbreak, taken off the front pad and clipped straight to midwicket
flat on middle and leg, stays in the crease and steers a single through square
tossed up, on off stump but Taylor premeditates a paddle, reaches out and gets it through short fine leg for a couple
comes forward and pushes one more down the ground
flighted, outside off, skips forward and drills inside-out over cover, hands flowing through the shot and it picks the gap between the men in the deep. Lovely stuff
pushed through on the stumps, nurdled through the leg side
legbreak straightening on off stump, drops back and guides it to short third man
flighted, Taylor waits for it to drop outside off and chips it in the air down to long-off
back of a length outside off, Taylor chops it in slightly ungainly fashion towards backward point
short outside off and this time he steers it through gully wide of third man for a couple

full and straight, Taylor tries to heave it over long-on... but is smacked flush on the pads, that is gone! That was a cutter from Finn, slightly slower and it gripped a fraction, beat Taylor's big ole swing and pinned him on the back leg in front of middle and off - easy decision for Rob Bailey
shortish and defended with an open bat face, straight to gully
dug in, back of a length, Elliott goes back and across and dabs it down again
tight line and Elliott prods defensively in front of square
back of a length outside off, reaches for the cut and toes it to backward point
closer to the stumps, this time Williamson waits on it and opens the face in familiar style, runs it to third man
short, too short, bouncing over Elliot's head outside off
pitched up in the channel and Elliott checks a drive through the covers, times it well and the ball outruns Morgan giving chase from mid-off
beaten, cracking delivery from Wood, seaming a fraction as Elliott played away from his body
attacks the stumps, fullish and worked with a turn of the wrists for one to midwicket
precisely done by Williamson, picks a slower delivery and spanks it square, past the diving fielder and well in front of third man, that's four
back of a length in the channel, tapped down towards point
excellent line, kicking off a length and climbing past the outside edge as Elliott hung back
short, coming back in at 85mph, tries to cut but it cramped and pats it to backward point
length outside off, reaches for a back-foot drive, comes off the outer half of the bat and Stokes snaffles it in the gully
off-stump line, maybe straightens a fraction, pushed into the covers, not where he was aiming
back of a length, really disciplined line from Finn and Elliott can only block it on the back foot... The lesser-spotted maiden
shortish outside off, tapped towards point from back in the crease
straighter line and Williamson closes the face, works one through backward square
shortish, outside off, drops back and defends with a straight bat
goes wide and fires it in, 89mph and punched back, straight into the non-striker's stumps... Wood goes and grabs the ball and a stump, just in case, before flashing Williamson a grin
another play and a miss from Elliott, done for pace but a short-of-a-length ball in the channel, attempting to cut
length outside off, attacks with a full-blooded mow, gets a top edge down to third man on the bounce - Elliott keeps the strike
short and coming in at the body, tries to work across the line but gets hit in the midriff and Finn chases it up in his follow through
Elliott can't get it away again, short and straight, pushed back to the bowler
length ball, on the stumps and Elliott plays across it, hit on the back leg and Finnbelts out an appeal... Bailey shakes his head, maybe a touch high, leg side as well. England elect not to review
fullish, on middle and leg, whipped away this time, gets a single through square leg

full outside off, another cutter from Finn, driven on the up and Morgan leaps to get there, flying to his right... but can't hold on once again. Was a superb effort moving to his right at mid-off, one-handed but couldn't grab it, England ground another
well, that's gone... Elliott has woken up, skips forward and plants Finn over long-off, not totally in control, as it flew waaaaaaaay up but carried beyond the rope
on the stumps, 88mph and flicked away through leg
Jehoshaphat, that's a snorter! Short and climbing through at throat height, practically singing Elliott's beard as he jack-knifed back out of the way
drops back in the crease and nudges one off his body to get off strike
length outside off, tapped square
fractionally short outside off, plays with a horizontal bat and dabs one to third man
back of a length over the top of off and Elliott prods it back down the track... End of Wood's spell, decent figures of 1 for 49
full length at the stumps, this is tapped back to the bowler
drops the length and this is turned out down to long leg
driven loosely from off stump off a thick inside edge wide of mid-on
short again and this is again turned down to long leg
stays back of a length just outside off, this is angle to backward point
fuller on the stumps, whips this down to long leg
full length just outside off, this is driven down to long-off
clears the front leg here and swings a full ball wide of long-on, well struck

tries again and this time picks out mid-on! Big wicket for England, Williamson falls short of his ton. Trying to drive over the leg side again with the fielder up at mid-on but hasn't got enough on this and it's taken by Rashid above his head, claiming a solid chance. Great time for England to strike
full length a foot outside off, this is driven down to long-off
length now around middle and leg, gets a thick inside edge that runs off the pad back to the keeper
played from the crease out into midwicket for a quick single
full length at the stumps, this is flicked up to long-on
back of a length, this is pulled out to deep square
angled in to the pads and Ronchi picks this up really well and almost sends it for six wide of long leg
flicked leg side again and almost carries this to deep square but lands just short
full length, another leg side flick, this only to mid-on
fuller and this is worked out wide of mid-on
full length outside off, this is driven to extra-cover
straighter and this is swung down the ground, fine strike goes all the way
this slips out as a chest-high full toss, this is delicately angled down fine of third man who does well to save four
makes this land and it's swung hard down the ground but straight along the ground to long-off

goes to flick a straight ball leg side and picks out midwicket. Simply not a great connection and finds the fielder right on the edge of the circle where Stokes took the catch above his head. Trying to whip this across the line was Ronchi and it didn't pan out as expected, another good scalp for England
full length a foot wide of off stump, mistimed drive wide of mid-off
nice delivery, slides this across the right-hander and beats the bat
full length wide of off stump but not too wide, nicely bowled
slower ball but it slips down leg
low full toss just outside off, this is driven and totally mistimed but out through cover
slower ball, spotted, Elliott down the track to it and slams it wide of long-on
full length on the stumps, this is worked down to long-on
full length driven to extra-cover who saves so well going to his right but then throws at the non-striker's end stumps, connects, and the ball ricochets away for an overthrow
low full toss tapped up towards mid-off, they take on the single and get home easily
picks up a length ball off a huge top edge that flies over the short boundary at long leg, other side of the ground and the fielder might have got around to that
targets the short fence again and whacks this into this once again with a heave across the line
great shot, steps across the stumps, Willey followed him, Elliott adjusts and lifts this wide of long-off, superb timing
full toss outside off, only slapped to extra-cover, a misfield allows them a single and Elliott goes to fifty in 45 balls, crucial role here for Elliott
back of a length ball, Santner rocks back to pull down the ground off high on the bat and it bloops down to long-on
steps across the stumps to line up the leg side once more, Willey sent down a cutter and it did the trick, Elliott through with the stroke and missed
full length wide of off stump, comes off a thick inside edge and runs through square leg, rolls out slowly and they get back for a second
low full toss and this is bunted down the ground, enough bat on this and with mid-on up it goes to the rope
Santner falls over here carving a low full toss from just outside off to deep cover
good yorker, dug out to short third man and they jog a single
slower ball on the stumps, goes to whip this to leg and misses, strikes the pad in line but pitched well outside leg
full toss, just a touch over waist height and this is missed but penalised
yorker length now, leant out for and gets this to extra-cover
slider first ball and Santner is down on one knee to whack it over square leg, aha, he's now middled one!
bit more air and Santner goes for the same shot and whacks it into the crowd! Huge!
tries again and this time misses, this slips past the leg side heave and the off stump
dragged down a little and Santner whacks it leg side again, deep midwicket is out there but runs out of room! Can't lean back
flat delivery slips down the leg side, this is helped on it's way and four more
huge slog sweep yet again and this is hammered over midwicket once more, best of the lot this, sweet strike from just outside off, goes way back into the stands
slower ball on the stumps, lifted down the ground, not got it at all but it's just out of the reach of mid-off running back
back away to leg, Stokes follows him and it comes off the pad to square leg
slower ball outside off, swung at and gets it behind point and away from deep cover

fuller length, whacked over the off side but picks out deep cover. Not this time for Santner, leaning back trying to find the same stand as the previous over, nowhere near as good a connection and picks out the fielder taking a straightforward catch
full ball, big strike down the ground but straight to long-on
another stuck down the ground, Finn does well going to his right at mid-off keeping it to only a single
goes to swing a length ball leg side and misses completely, struck on the pad outside leg

another swing, gets this out over the leg side but not far enough, deep midwicket is under it and takes the catch! Very smartly taken moving forward, a inch or two from the turf, nice work from Stokes. Southee going for the big swing but not getting enough of this
down the track, drives this in the air but one bounce to long-on
down the track and a wild swing gets a thick outside edge that runs out wide of cover and they get two to the left of deep cover
another wild swing, a thick outside edge lands short of backward point
jumps right across the stumps, aims a big shot leg side but misses and it comes off the thigh pad to point

inn2.comm: length outside off, good carry through to the keeper as Roy shoulders arms
pitched up and Roy moves aggressively into the ball, blocks towards mid-off
angled across from over the wicket, on a length and again left alone
good line from Wheeler, probing around the off stump, Roy drives half forward to mid-on
pitched up and Roy is on to the front foot, checks a push into the off side
pinned on the crease, maybe some swing there but it was quite high, beat Roy on the inside - Wheeler starts with a maiden
fullish, around the line of off, Hales presses forward and defends
length delivery, drifting on to the pads and Hales flicks one through backward square
gets this one through, excellent length from Southee, drawing Roy forwards and nipping it back, over the top of the stumps
middle and off, pitched up and driven, straight to mid-on
beats him again, definite movement back from outside off but Roy had left a big gap reaching out for the ball in front of him
slides down the leg side again, flicks at it and the ball deflects off the pads behind square, bit of a misfield on the 45 and they get two
angled across, little bit of shape and Hales shows it a solid straight bat
full, outside off, comes forward to drive but miscues it back to the bowler
runs, four of them, short and at the body and Hales swats it past the man at short fine leg and away for England's first boundary
driven off the back foot, nicely played by Hales, not a bad ball but he forces it past point, Guptill gives chase
slightly wide, not a half-volley but Roy leaves his crease, cuts down the angle and scythes it through the covers, excellent stroke
ho ho, even better, crunched straight back down the ground for six! Another menacing skip down the track and a bullying swing of the arms
fullish, around off stump, pushed back to the on side
good length outside off, stays back and chops into the ground towards point
full, on middle and off, brings the bat down towards mid-on and digs it out
touch short, touch wide and Hales gets more than a touch on it, crunched through point, powerful cut stroke and it gives the flying Guptill no chance
pitched up around the line of off, pushed back firmly to mid-off
full of a length in the channel, presses on to the front and drives, again finds mid-off
shortish and nudged off the hips for a single
banged in short, flying through as Hales elects not to try and pull... okay, as far as the umpires are concerned
pitched up on leg stump, Hales aims an almighty heave to the leg side, gets an inside edge on to his pads
shortish outside off, drops back and dabs into the covers, Hales wanted one but has to go back

full and whipped off the legs, in the air between deep backward square and fine leg, who chases it down, McClenaghan dives to palm it away from the boundary... but it zips past Santner coming the other way, then he slips trying to pull it in and the ball dribbles on to the rope
another bouncer, down the leg side, again gets away with it
comes forward to a length ball, tries to hit through the off side and gets a thick inside edge to deep midwicket
dug in short by Southee, swing and a miss across the line
full and straight, manages to squeeze it out through midwicket for a couple
full outside off, plants the front foot and spanks a drive straight to mid-off
stands tall and taps into the off side
pitched up and clipped off the legs through midwicket, it was actually in the air and the diving Santner got a hand to it - very tough chance though
back of a length and smeared through point, it wasn't wide but Roy manufactured some width and threw the hands through the shot
length, on the stumps, flicked away for one
back of a length outside off, prodded in front of square
half-tracker, down the leg side and helped on its way, healthy slug over fine leg from Hales, who likes to swat away the short stuff
another short ball, another lusty swing... and this flies over the man at fine leg, well into the crowd, six more!
pitched up, on the leg side flipped away wide of short fine leg, the man brought up on to the edge of the ring, for a couple more
full around off stump, comes forward and plays a nice-looking on drive straight to the fielder
edged but there's only one slip in and the ball flies wide, runs away for four!
on the stumps and nudged through square leg for one
width on offer, not overly short but Hales stays low and levers a mighty cut short hard through the covers for four
full, too straight from Southee and it's nonchalantly flicked for four more, over midwicket with another powerful stroke
pitched up again, almost a yorker and Hales digs it out past midwicket for one
over the wicket, pitched up outside off and Hales launches straight into a drive, finds mid-off
short and at the body, fine leg is up and Hales scoops a flat pull over the ring and away for four

length outside off, 82mph but Hales is not in control of this, bringing the bat down at an angle and a thick edge squirts high over what would be second-third slip and then bounces down to the boundary... More cheers around the ground, that's Hales' fifty, too
back of a length, pulled in the ground through midwicket for a couple
oh my, that's MASSIVE! Slightly full on off stump, Hales sends all his body weight through a hoick to leg and sends the ball miles back into the stands!
short this time, takes on the hook and a top edge carries well beyond the rope and into the crowd!
pitched up, outside off and dabbed back towards mid-on... Roy getting his eye in again
on the stumps, worked to the leg side for one
shortish, at the body, turns and nudges it away through square leg for one more
full and shaping away towards the tramlines and Roy swipes at it, Southee appeals for caught behind... and Steve Davis decides it should be a wide
launches into a drive on the up... and up is where the ball goes, swirling out towards deep extra cover, McCullum gives chase and throws himself bodily after the ball but won't get there!
hit on the knee roll, this nips back off a length, Southee appeals - maybe heading down the leg side
worked back towards mid-on for a single
preses forward and drives in front of square
dug in short, Hales rocks back and pulls powerfully, there's a man out at deep midwicket to cut it off
pitched up in the channel, on to the front foot, punches one more through the covers - up comes the 100 opening stand, from just 63 balls

advances and heaves across the line, Hales has dragged on! That's the way for bowlers to succeed in these crazy times - take wickets. Henry bellows in delight, middle stump out of the ground, NZ have got one
short of a length outside off, drops back and defends
back of a length outside off, driven off the back foot towards cover point
over the wicket, pitched up and blocked coming forwards
short ball, sits up to be hit and that's what Roy does, bashing a pull past midwicket and away to the fence
hits the pitch hard, around leg stump, pops off the bat in the air but short of mid-on
fullish outside off stump, Roy drives but it comes off the inside half the bat towards mid-on
good length, outside off and he chops down on it late
angled across, 86mph on a good length, Roy jams it into the ground towards gully
full and straight, nicely timed off the pads and Root gets his first runs out towards deep midwicket
on the stumps, pushed wide of mid-on for a single
pitched up, squeezes the bat down, rolls towards mid-on
Henry drops short and Roy floats down the pitch and KPs it away through midwicket, flamboyant pull on the walk, races away to the boundary

on the charge again, not to the pitch but he rifles a drive... straight to extra cover! Instinctive catch from Williamson, he can't have had any time to process it, just got the hands in the right position and braced for impact - took a scorcher right in front of his chest
full and wide, Morgan drives square, straight to a fielder but a misfield gives him two to get off the mark
pitched up on the stumps, clipped through backward square
fractionally full in the channel outside off and that's skelped for four more through point, lovely timing
tighter line from McClenaghan, climbing off a length in the channel, Morgan leaves
line and length, foot outside off, again lets it through
short and at the body, Morgan rolls his arms on a pull out to deep square leg
dug in short of a length, Mitch McC grunting away, Root defends softly down outside off
fullish, driven through the covers to the cover sweeper
slightly short and Root latches on to a cut, bouncing up past backward point... where Guptill plucks it brilliantly out of the air
slightly full, outside the line of off, Root squires it back down the ground, just beats the dive of McCullum at mid-off and runs away
leading edge but it falls between extra cover and point! Root trying to close the face on a length ball, gets one
back of a length and tapped down into the leg side

back of a length, Root pulls outside off... there's an enthusiastic appeal for caught behind, not given by Rob Bailey but NZ review. Has this brushed the inside edge? No, replays quickly confirm the ball flicked the pocket, so the decision stands and NZ lose their review
pitched up outside off stump, Morgan presses forwards and drives through backward point, there's a sweeper and they get one

stays back and tries to force the ball too close to him, thick edge but dropped by Taylor at slip, seemed like he didn't pick it up... He actually jumped, as if it would fly over him, then had to reach to his right one-handed and missed the ball
full on the off stump, driven back and McClenaghan sprawls to field, can't prevent one
zips through outside off as Morgan hangs out the bat
shortish, at the body, stays back and nurdles one into a gap at midwicket
here comes Morgan, strides out to a length ball and wallops it flat over long-off for six!
down the leg side, Morgan flicks and misses... well, there's an appeal by Henry but looked like another case of trousering
short ball, pulled through midwicket, it was in the air but no one was near
back of a length, Root cross-bats one through midwicket this time
pitched up and worked towards mid-on from the crease
back of a length, pushed across outside off, attempted cut and a bottom edge bounces down on to the pitch
length ball just outside off nudged out through the covers
full ball outside off, very nicely driven and timed so well out to deep cover-point
full around off, Root flicking against the angle gets this out to deep square
back of a length at the body, this is pulled down to long leg
not quite as short, Root stays back and forced out to the off side sweeper
short ball, Morgan goes to uppercut and misses, deemed a legal delivery too
enough width to cut this wide of third man to get back for the second
much tighter line and just defended this time in the crease
fuller, this is driven to mid-on's left and they take a quick single
full at the pads, clipped out through square leg brings the 150 up
shorter, pulled straight to deep square but Southee misfields and they get back for the second
low full toss and Root bunts it down the ground, inside mid-on, well timed
slides this in from around the wicket, nudged out through midwicket
over to the right-hander, this is driven down to long-on
just outside off, this is pressed to cover
low full toss driven down the ground, long-on to his right fields
middle and leg line, this is clipped out towards square leg but not far enough wide of the fielder to allow a second run
length ball around off stump, this is flicked back to the bowler
fine shot, beautiful straight drive past mid-on, won't get too many timed better than that
does time this one though and a thick edge finds mid-on
short enough to cut, finds deep square
pitched up outside off and Morgan shimmies to his right to create space to swing his arms through the line of this and nails it over long-on, gorgeous timing
tries to pull, too tight for the stroke, gets this high off the bat wide of midwicket
opens the face here to guide this to third man
inside edge trying to back foot drive into his pad
flat delivery at the pads, Root tries a paddle sweep and misses
another paddle, this finds short long leg
tad shorter, works this out to deep square
pitched up just outside off, this is pressed down to long-off
full on the stumps, this is driven down to long-on
back on the stumps pushing this towards long-on, not wide enough of the fielder for a second
clears the front leg to drive this straight ball down to long-on
flat delivery into the pads, carefully worked out in front of square leg and they charge back for the second run
similar delivery this is worked straight to deep midwicket
low full toss around leg stump, this is flicked down to long-on
length ball just outside off, this flicked out down to long-on for an easy run
back across the off stump pushing a length ball down to long-on
length ball pressed down to long-off, driving through the line
swept off the stumps to short long leg
dragged down and Root is onto it, pulling backward of deep square
tries again, touch fuller this time, comes off high on the bat to short long leg, wide enough for a run
of course the boundaries do help! This is a fine tickle to a ball just a touch too straight and runs away very fine
forward flicking only to midwicket
length ball from off stump driven to extra-cover
back flicking backward of square leg for a quick single
back trying to cut, a little cramped, this is ran out to cover
started to move to the leg side, Santner followed him, Morgan jumped back inside the line to flick a single through square leg
forward working this wide of long-on for a couple and brings up a half-century for Joe Root, can he capitalise having being dropped here?
around the wicket, Morgan steps to leg to create room to swing over the off side and just squirts it over backward point, not in full control of that but all the fielders are up on the off side
straight line tapped up to midwicket
creates space again and this time plays a lovely controlled lofted drive over extra-cover, great timing, safe with no-one back
delicate tap here into square leg and they sprint a sharp single
shimmy down the wicket to flick a single down to long-on
quicker ball, Morgan presses from the crease to extra-cover
length ball just outside off, this is dabbed down to third man
just defends this a shade outside off, backward point up quickly
back of a length just outside off and Morgan is onto the length in a flash to pull over wide midwicket, fine timing and fifty in 39 balls
back on a full length but this is down the leg side
full length around off stump, Morgan forward to this blocking out towards extra-cover
low full toss outside off, Morgan drives nicely and mid-off is very wide so this races away for four
another drive, this straighter but the timing was just as good, superb from Morgan
length around off stump, this is blocked in the crease out into the covers
poor ball, short down the leg side and Root helps it fine of long leg
back on a fourth-stump line, this is tucked up to mid-off
back of a length but Root can only pull this as far as deep midwicket
length or a touch short of around off stump, this is calmly defended
wide outside off and this is left alone
full length at the stumps, this is driven up to mid-on
drives towards mid-off now and no single available again
wide line and cut, no-one back on the off side and this runs away for four
tight line, Root waits for this and angles down to third man
goes to cut a ball a little too close to do so and misses here
tries to come down the wicket, Southee sees him coming and fires this at the body, Morgan adjusts well and angles this out through the covers
full just outside off, this is driven up to mid-on
runs down the wicket, McClenaghan bangs it in but Morgan latches onto it and pulls over wide mid-on, what a shot, almost six!
outside off now, Morgan looking for an uppercut misses
length ball on a tight line, Morgan manages to tuck this up on the leg side and they sprint a single
around the wicket, length ball at the off stump, this is dabbed back to the bowler
full length just outside off, this is driven up to mid-off

skips out and launches the ball high out towards deep midwicket, it comes down with icicles on it, just between Grant Elliott and Ben Wheeler - they actually nearly collided but managed to avoid each other at the last moment as the ball landed safely. Not quite where Morgan was intending it to go
drives one more through the covers
back of a length over off stump, nurdles one through midwicket
pitched up, angled across from over the wicket, firmly punched to extra cover
goes around the wicket, fullish and firmly punched to short extra cover
touch back of a length, jumps up to hit the splice as Morgan takes his bottom hand off the bat - decent over from Henry
around the wicket, sits in the crease and punches through the covers with a straight bat - they think about two but the throw is good
floated up towards off stump, nicely in the slot and Morgan crumps a half-volley back down the ground through mid-off
drags his length back, Morgan shows it a straight bat in defence
short, at the body, Morgan flips it off his hips through midwicket and they amble one
shortish, drops back on off stump and blocks
width, slightly short and Root rattles a cut through backward point, superbly played - and up comes the England 250, runs required now into double figures
goes around the wicket, angled in on a length and chopped from close to the body towards point
good length, tight to the off stump, Morgan taps it down into the covers
this is excellent from Henry, hitting the pitch hard and no width, steered to backward point
dug in shot and pulled in an arc through the air out towards deep square leg, one bounce to the fielder
goes over the wicket, short of a length and punched into the covers off the back foot
tight line from Henry, 85mph and dug into the ground back towards the bowler, Henry leaps in his follow through to get a hand on it
over the wicket, goes full on middle and leg, hits the pad and rolls to the on side
around the wicket, speared in full, nicely timed drive but straight to mid-on from Root
pitched up and clipped off the front pad, again picks out the fielder, this time at midwicket
beautiful stroke, too full again and this time Root rifles a drive past mid-on, away to the boundary - releases a small amount of pressure that had built up
slightly back of a length, wheels around to paddle one through square leg
back over the wicket, full length in the channel, steered towards point half forwards
shortish, Root swivels on an attempted pull but carves out fresh air
stays back and punches a length ball into the covers
tight line from Henry, drives a length ball back to the bowler
bit of width now, Root flays at the ball, takes the top edge of his cut and flies in the air, bouncing down to third man for one
goes around the wicket, length delivery angled in and Morgan pushes forwards, loops off the pads into the leg side and they get one as Henry chases after it - 150 partnership up now
shortish, 82mph and again some width, Root slaps one through the covers to the sweeper
goes around the wicket, Root defends a length ball on off stump
in the channel outside off, not particularly short, Root sits back and late dabs down to third man
skips forward, Morgan has picked his gap and he sends the ball back the way it came, skimming through mid-off for four
length ball outside off, tries to flick to leg, loops short towards midwicket
makes room, clearing the front leg to hit down the ground, this was on a length and Morgan does just as he pleases with it, launching it over mid-on for six
good length around off stump, jumps across and nudges two more through midwicket
comes forward to drive a length ball through the covers for one
goes around the wicket, full length, scrambled seam, I think... and Morgan gets out his whisk and batters it over long-off for six more! Such clean striking, into the 90s now
skips forward, Henry follows him, cramps the batsman, only for a thick inside edge to squirt down to fine leg! Insult to injury
length on the stumps, shifts across and taps into the off side

length again, Morgan lines it up and smashes the ball high into the stands at deep midwicket - off comes the helmet, a century for Morgan to celebrate and off just 73 balls. That would be quick, in normal circumstances, but it's England's slowest of the series so far!
full toss, swatted away behind square on the leg side, it's got through for more runs... NZ are holed below the waterline and sinking fast!
goes around the wicket, drops back and glides one to third man
length in the channel outside off, goes back and defends with a straight bat
angled in towards the wicket, Root whips the ball away through square for a couple
shortish, tries to nudge the ball off his hips and loses his footing... very nearly kicked his stumps, there
around the wicket, low full toss bunted back down the ground to mid-off
pitched up outside off and Root leans out to caress a perfect square drive to the fence
good length on off stump and Morgan shows it a straight bat
shortish, at the body, skips down the pitch and hefts it over midwicket, away into the open spaces for four
bit of width and chopped towards point off the back foot
short ball, pulls at it and misses
comes forward and stabs one through the off side, out towards wide long-off
drops a little short, Root goes back and defends

short ball from around the wicket, tucks Morgan up a little and he hooks in the air, straight to fine leg! Morgan goes for a brilliant hundred, roundly applauded from the field. Possibly a slower-ball bouncer from Southee, caused the misjudgement
full length outside off, driven along the ground to mid-off
steams in and hits the deck, short ball and it climbs as Southee takes a tumble - called wide, too
full and angling in from around the wicket, driven firmly through the covers, in front of the sweeper for a couple
goes over the wicket, length ball outside off, drops back and chops behind point for one
line and length outside off, late cut from Root wide of third man
length ball at the pads, tucked down to long leg...except their isn't a long leg in place
fourth-stump line, this is tucked back to the bowler
leans back to cut this and gets it out to deep cover
back of a length, Stokes pulls with three men out on the hook, safely on the bounce to deep midwicket
full length a foot or so wide of off stump and Root drives this majestically through extra-cover, super timing
straighter and shorter, this is clipped out to deep midwicket
full length at the off stump, this is driven back to the bowler
not quite as full, tries to whip this leg side and finds mid-on
wide outside off, leans out to drive this to deep cover
full on middle and leg, this is whipped to midwicket
goes for the reverse sweep, misses and it goes past leg stump
gentle flick from leg stump to short long leg
back foot drive back to the bowler
back foot punch inside mid-on but again no run available
two feet wide of off stump, this is driven to cover going to his left, dot again
back of a length, pulled away, oh it's a top edge towards midwicket, fielding running back dives...and can't get there! Root goes to a century, a lovely innings
wider on the bowling crease, goes to pull again, this comes off the gloves wide of the keeper for a single
length just outside off, this is driven off a thick inside edge up to mid-on
low full toss, this is clipped out to deep midwicket
slog sweep off the stumps, smeared leg side and finds the gap at midwicket
goes again and nails this properly, way back into the bleachers
and another, this straighter and hammered in front of the deep midwicket this time, such power
fired in and this is just tapped out to deep cover
length ball, Root down on one knee pulls and that will do it, four through midwicket
